author: Kim Mackrael
title: Canada’s Annual Inflation Rate Slowed in January to 1.7%
text:
OTTAWA—Headline inflation in Canada slowed in January, while measures of underlying prices strengthened to their highest level since mid-2016.
Canada’s consumer-price index rose 1.7% on a year-over-year basis in January, Statistics Canada said Friday, following a 1.9% advance in December. Market expectations were for a 1.5% increase, according to economists at Royal Bank of Canada.
